data.title: Speed Skating Lap Times
data.statement:
In short track speed skating, skaters race around a 111 metre track. They compete in several different distances, and they are timed on how fast they can complete it. For a given time split into minutes and seconds, and a distance in metres, what is the average lap time (to the nearest tenth) of the skater for that race, and how fast are they going to the nearest kilometre per hour?

Hint:
Speed is distance divided by time
data.stubGenerator:
read M:int
read S:int
read D:int
write avg lap time
write speed
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[M]] for the number of minutes in the time
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[S]] for the number of seconds in the time
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[D]] for the distance in metres for the race
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The average lap time to the nearest tenth of a second
<<Line 2:>> The speed of the lap time to the nearest kilometre per hour

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In short track speed skating, skaters race around a 111 metre track. They compete in several different distances, and they are timed on how fast they can complete it. For a given time split into minutes and seconds, and a distance in metres, what is the average lap time (to the nearest tenth) of the skater for that race, and how fast are they going to the nearest kilometre per hour?

Hint:
Speed is distance divided by time
Input
Line 1: An integer M for the number of minutes in the time
Line 2: An integer S for the number of seconds in the time
Line 3: An integer D for the distance in metres for the race
Output
Line 1: The average lap time to the nearest tenth of a second
Line 2: The speed of the lap time to the nearest kilometre per hour
Constraints
0 ≤ M,S < 60
Example
Input
2
12
1500
Output
9.8
41
